What is your overall assessment of this course

Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved

Comments_List: 1 most weeks, then many more for the final paper
1 hour

Great survey course of FDA law and current issues regarding drug safety and efficacy. Aaron is an engaging professor, and I loved that we began each class with a discussion of relevant current events. Overall, I learned a great deal, not to mention it was such a relief in the semester to have weeks where class was not held. I also didn't mind the extra class sessions at all. Overall, a great class!

I think the instructor is the main strength; he is an expert in the field and so knowledgeable. I wish the class met more often, but I understand that Dr. Kesselheim's schedule could make that difficult.
The course is a great introduction to how FDA works and the thinking process behind this public agency.

This course was a smaller discussion course which was nice, Dr. Kesselheim's lectures were interesting, current, and relevant and provided a good overview of the FDA and current FDA activities. It would have been nice to focus a few lectures on the "Food" in FDA instead of just drugs.
The class is good but a little difficult to keep up on the readings without a good understanding of law jargon.
very passionate about all FDA subjects and very knowledgable.

He is a god among men, the absolute leader in his field. Was very approachable, made classes almost seem like a conversation between him and the students. Always brought Crazy Donut to class, which was great!
Aaron is a great professor!
I really liked Dr. Kesselheim. He is knowledgeable, approachable, and encouraging.
Aaron is very knowledgeable and informative.
The instructor is great!

Great professor! Very engaging and interested in helping us learn about the FDA and think critically about current FDA-related events. Might have been interesting to have students present during a week, or for part of a class to facilitate more discussion and engage those who are not as familiar with the law side of the FDA and public health.
Very good at discussing the topic
Super nice, helpful, and knowledgeable

Professor Kesselheim is AMAZING! He is extremely knowledgeable and has written everything out there about drug-related policies! He really cares that you learn from the materials. This is my first course at the Law school and I really enjoy it! I learn a lot and love the reading assignments!
This is essentially a seminar class. It meets once every week or two for two hours, and the only assignment is a paper at the end. I think it is interesting material and worth taking.
I highly recommend the course
The course is great!

This course was a great way to start Monday mornings (especially with the donuts Dr. Kesselheim brought for us), the readings and discussions provided a thorough overview of the FDA's activities related to drugs (food topics were not discussed) and current events related to the FDA. I would recommend this course, even if you do not have a law background, to learn more about public health law and consider how your interests are related to the FDA and laws.
This is a great course to get some working knowledge of how the FDA works
Take this course!!!!
